My first visit to McDermott’s private art gallery was in the late 1990s, when I was attracted to his black and white photography of the land I loved. Since then, I have returned to Siem Reap many times and bought a calendar and some photos every year. I returned to Cambodia and was told that the gallery had moved from the FCC site to the Raffles Hotel, but after I arrived at the Raffles Hotel, I was told that the gallery had moved to somewhere in Thailand. The FCC has recently closed for renovations, so I hope McDermott’s private art gallery will return to its original home.

reviews.comment: Before I came to this store, I always thought that in tourist cities like Siem Reap, there was no one very decent or very high-end comprehensive mall other than duty-free shops. But it wasn’t until I found out here that I found this mall so interesting, and there are a lot of pedestrians. The international brands we all know can be found here, such as Starbucks. There is a very large store in it. It's the only Starbucks I found in downtown Siem Reap.

It is also regarded as an accidental punching place in Siem Reap. When passing by him, I saw the lights outside and was celebrating the New Year's Eve. So I came in and turned around, the whole mall is very lively, whether it is on the steps outside the mall, or in the shopping center in the mall, everyone is buying things very desperately, or taking photos to commemorate the arrival of 2020. I especially like this decoration in front of the mall, which gives me a feeling of returning to the big city.
